Lambdas that act as extension functions, allowing you to add behavior to existing types.
An interface defined with type parameters to work with different data types.
Single Abstract Method conversion; allows using a lambda as an implementation for interfaces with one abstract method.
A keyword allowing a function to accept a variable number of arguments.
A function capturing and retaining access to variables from its surrounding scope.
A type or class that can operate with different data types using type parameters.
A resizable list implementation in Kotlin, part of the standard library.
A function defined inside a class, accessible by its instances.
A contract in Kotlin that defines methods without implementing them; classes can implement multiple interfaces.
A keyword in Kotlin used for a class to fulfill the contract of an interface.
Treating an object of a subclass as an object of its superclass or interface.
A keyword used to provide a new implementation for an inherited method in a subclass.
A class derived from another class, inheriting its properties and behaviors.
A Kotlin class for holding data, automatically provides equals, hashCode, and toString methods.
A collection that stores unique elements without any particular order, using hashing for fast access.
A structured set of exception classes, usually with inheritance, representing different error types.
A function, often used for logging or displaying information during program execution.
A Kotlin function that throws an IllegalArgumentException if its condition is false.
A type that can hold either a value or null, indicated by a '?' in Kotlin.
A special function that initializes a new object of a class.
A class member that combines a field with optional getter and setter methods.
A special function used to initialize objects of a class.
A class from which another class inherits properties and functions.
A singleton declaration that defines a single instance of a class.
A visibility modifier restricting access to within the containing class or file.
Describes a data structure whose contents can be changed after creation.
A variable or function accessible throughout the entire Kotlin file, but not outside it.
A Kotlin extension function to read lines from a file safely, automatically closing the resource after use.
A Kotlin function that processes each line in a file, executing a given action for every line.
An interface for objects that need to release resources when no longer used.
A Kotlin extension function that automatically closes a resource after use.
An anonymous function that can be passed as an argument or assigned to a variable.
A control flow expression in Kotlin, similar to switch in other languages.
A Kotlin expression for branching execution based on value matching, similar to switch in other languages.
A logging utility or function, possibly providing thread-safe logging to files or other outputs.
A logging library or utility used to record events or errors in applications.
A class or object responsible for writing log messages to files or outputs.
A logging function used to record error-level messages or exceptions.
A function, often related to processing or handling a transaction or operation.
A block used to handle exceptions thrown in a try block.
A user-defined type consisting of a set of named values, called elements or members.
A variable or function accessible throughout a single source file, but not outside it.
The part of a function that defines its name, parameters, and return type.
A function that checks if two values are equal in unit tests.
A Kotlin library providing utilities for writing and running tests.
A function that checks if two values are equal in unit tests.
Top-level code or declarations in a file, not inside any class or function.
A function defined with type parameters, allowing it to operate on different data types.
A Kotlin class representing a range of integer values, defined by a start and end.
Functions defined inside a class that operate on its instances.
A special class for defining a fixed set of constants in Kotlin.
An object inside a class whose members can be accessed like static members.
Functions that add new functionality to existing classes without modifying their source code.
Defining or changing the behavior of operators (like +, []) for user-defined types.
A Kotlin collection that supports both read and write operations, allowing elements to be modified.
A special class in Kotlin that automatically provides useful methods like equals and toString.
Breaking an object into its component properties for easy assignment to variables.
A method automatically generated in Kotlin data classes to access the first property.
A method automatically generated in Kotlin data classes to access the tenth property.
A Kotlin collection that allows modification of its elements and size.
A Kotlin keyword to declare a read-only (immutable) variable.
A Kotlin keyword to declare a mutable variable whose value can change.
An operator (e.g., -=) that subtracts and assigns in one step.
An operator (e.g., +=) that adds and assigns in one step.
An interface for classes whose instances can be ordered or compared to each other.
A map collection whose entries can be modifiedadded, updated, or removed.
A function that randomly rearranges the elements in a collection.
A set collection that maintains its elements in sorted order.
A Kotlin delegate that initializes a value only when it is first accessed.
A record or output showing the sequence of executed operations or function calls.
A Kotlin property delegate that initializes the value only when it is first accessed.
A code block or expression that sets the initial value of a property or variable.
A Kotlin keyword for declaring a read-only (immutable) variable.
A block of code that sets up a property or variable when it's first accessed or created.
Automatically determined by the compiler based on context, rather than specified explicitly by the programmer.
A blueprint in Kotlin that defines methods and properties to be implemented by classes.
A variable associated with a class or object, accessed via getters and setters.
A variable or function declared outside any class or function, visible throughout the file.
A modifier for declaring a non-null variable that will be initialized later.
A property delegate that initializes the value on first access and caches the result.
Kotlin modifier allowing a non-null variable to be initialized after object construction.
Kotlin class automatically providing equals(), hashCode(), and toString() for storing data.
Kotlin collection function that applies a given action to each element in the collection.
A special data type that enables for a variable to be a set of predefined constants.
Initial code provided to help begin a programming task or exercise.
A block in a control structure, such as 'finally', that executes specific code under certain conditions.
A feature allowing classes and functions to operate with different data types using type parameters.
A function added to a class without modifying its source code.
Initial code provided to help begin a programming task or project.
Functions added to existing classes without modifying their source code, common in Kotlin for enhancing functionality.
A popular integrated development environment (IDE) for JVM languages like Kotlin and Java.
Operator function in Kotlin for property delegation to retrieve a property's value.
Operator function in Kotlin for property delegation to set a property's value.
Kotlin keyword used to delegate property implementation to another object.
A special class in Kotlin for holding data; automatically provides equals, hashCode, and toString.
A mechanism in Kotlin where property access is handled by a delegate object.
A Kotlin delegate that throws an exception if the property is accessed before being initialized.
A placeholder for a type used in generic programming, specified when creating an instance.
A Kotlin property delegate that notifies when a property's value changes.
A keyword in Kotlin to indicate a function replaces a superclass or interface implementation.
A Kotlin feature allowing property behavior to be delegated to another object.
The ability of Kotlin code to interact with Java code within the same project or application.
A Kotlin feature allowing property access to be delegated to another object.
A collection that stores key-value pairs, allowing fast retrieval by key.
A function added to an existing class without modifying its source code.
A Kotlin class that holds three values, possibly of different types, as a single object.
A Kotlin function that creates a mutable list, allowing elements to be added or removed.
A Kotlin operator (!!) that throws an exception if a nullable value is null.
A special function used to initialize a new object of a class.
To create a new class based on an existing class, inheriting its properties and methods.
A type that defines abstract members to be implemented by classes or objects.
A keyword used to provide a new implementation for an inherited member function.
A special function used to initialize objects when a class is instantiated.
A function that throws an exception if its condition is false, used for validating function arguments.
A function that throws an exception if its condition is false, used for verifying internal logic.
Automated tests that check the correctness of small, isolated pieces of code.
A keyword allowing a function to accept a variable number of arguments.
A function used to output or log information for debugging or tracking program execution.
